Package com.company

Class GameBoard

java.lang.Object
com.company.GameBoard
public class GameBoard
extends java.lang.Object
Holds the backend game logic for the Snake game, including movement and collision checking.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    GameBoard​(int pXpixels, int pYpixels)
    Constructor.

    Accesses the Y-Coordinate of the food in its current position.

    Accesses the SnakeNode containing the head of the snake.

    Accesses the number of pixels in the X direction on the GameBoard.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameBoard

      public GameBoard​(int pXpixels, int pYpixels)
      Constructor. Creates a new GameBoard of the specified dimensions.
      Parameters:
      pXpixels - One less than the number of pixels in the x direction desired for the GameBoard (ex. 0 is one pixel)
      pYpixels - One less than the number of pixels in the y direction desired for the GameBoard (ex. 0 is one pixel)

  • Method Details

    • moveSnake

      public void moveSnake()
      Moves each body segment of the snake by one pixel.

    • isDead

      public boolean isDead()
      Checks if the snake moving into its current position has resulted in its death.
      Returns:
      true if the snake is dead, false otherwise.

    • hasWon

      public boolean hasWon()
      Checks if the snake covers the area of the entire board, thus winning the game.
      Returns:
      true if the snake is the covering the entire board, false otherwise.

    • checkEaten

      public void checkEaten​(int tailX, int tailY)
      Checks if the snake, in its current position, can eat the food in its current position.
      Parameters:
      tailX - The X-Coordinate of the tail of the snake in its current position, used to extend the snake should the need arise.
      tailY - The Y-Coordinate of the tail of the snake in its current position, used to extend the snake should the need arise.

    • getFoodXCoord

      public int getFoodXCoord()
      Accesses the X-Coordinate of the food in its current position.
      Returns:
      The X-Coordinate of the food in its current position.

    • getFoodYCoord

      public int getFoodYCoord()
      Accesses the Y-Coordinate of the food in its current position.
      Returns:
      The Y-Coordinate of the food in its current position.

    • setFoodXCoord

      public void setFoodXCoord​(int pFoodXCoord)
      Modifies the X-Coordinate of the food to that of the parameter pFoodXCoord.
      Parameters:
      pFoodXCoord - The desired new X-Coordinate for the food.

    • setFoodYCoord

      public void setFoodYCoord​(int pFoodYCoord)
      Modifies the Y-Coordinate of the food to that of the parameter pFoodYCoord.
      Parameters:
      pFoodYCoord - The desired new Y-Coordinate for the food.

    • getHead

      public SnakeNode getHead()
      Accesses the SnakeNode containing the head of the snake.
      Returns:
      The SnakeNode containing the head of the snake.

    • setHeadDirection

      public void setHeadDirection​(int direction)
      Modifies the direction in which the snake is travelling.
      Parameters:
      direction - The desired direction of travel for the snake.

    • getTail

      public SnakeNode getTail()
      Accesses the SnakeNode containing the tail of the snake.
      Returns:
      The SnakeNode containing the tail of the snake.

    • getXpixels

      public int getXpixels()
      Accesses the number of pixels in the X direction on the GameBoard.
      Returns:
      The number of pixels in the X direction on the GameBoard - 1.

    • getYpixels

      public int getYpixels()
      Accesses the number of pixels in the Y direction on the GameBoard.
      Returns:
      The number of pixels in the Y direction on the GameBoard - 1.
